about.aboutDescription: Solity is an on-chain mobility service provider built on Solana. Users fund account in SOL, which settle transparently to the Solity Treasury. Our flagship product, SolityNET, lets you place global, low-latency voice calls with flexible caller identity options. Next, we're rolling out a suite of innovative mobility products that reject the usual corporate limitations, making connectivity more open, programmable, and user-controlled.
about.solityNetDescription: SolityNET is a comprehensive solution to decentralize global telephony. At launch, calling will be available in the US and Canada. We can onboard 80+ countries, but to avoid overloading the network we'll expand coverage gradually - adding regions day by day.

solityNetCall.title: SolityNET Call
solityNetCall.description: We're rolling out the SolityNET calling feature to the public. It took just three months to go from idea to live product - our first step toward becoming the leading crypto-native mobility provider.

coverageIncrease.title: SolityNET Coverage Increase
coverageIncrease.description: Daily coverage expansions are planned. 40+ countries are queued for rollout. We'll post day-by-day updates on X.

solityNetApi.title: SolityNET API
solityNetApi.description: Opening up the SolityNET API brings full integration flexibility. Hook up your own systems - or connect an AI assistant that can place calls on your behalf, from ordering pizza to scheduling business meetings.

solityNetSms.title: SolityNET SMS
solityNetSms.description: Decentralized outbound SMS is fully feasible and in active development. As with calling, we're focusing on sending only; we won't support inbound SMS reception to avoid potential exposure of personal information.

aiAssistant.title: Solity AI Assistant
aiAssistant.description: A test launch of the AI assistant is planned before eSIM, since it's a core mobility feature. It can replace voicemail, screen incoming calls as your gatekeeper, and handle simple tasks like \"book a table\" or \"order pizza.\"

esimUs.title: Solity eSIM US
esimUs.description: The United States will be our first eSIM market, offering direct telephony with unique/custom extension numbers. Global coverage is a key goal on our roadmap.

howToUse.title: How to Use
howToUse.description: Follow these steps to deposit SOL and make a call. Use the device toggle below. Images are small previews—click to zoom.
howToUse.videoFallback: Your browser doesn't support HTML video. Here is a

step1.title: Go to BALANCE (or CALL)
step1.description: In **Balance and Call pages** you can top up your internal balance to start making calls.

step2.title: Connect Phantom Wallet
step2.description: Click the **connect wallet button** and approve the connection in your Phantom wallet extension.

step3.title: Enter SOL amount and confirm transaction
step3.description:
- Enter a custom **SOL amount (min 0.1)**
- **Press Add button**
- Review the transaction details in your Phantom wallet and **click confirm** to complete the deposit.

**Transaction will be processing for ~30sec normally but can take up to 10min**

step4.title: You're all set 🎉
step4.description:
**Credits appear after confirmation.** Refresh if needed.

The status will change from **processing** to **paid** and balance will be updated.

step5.title: Making calls
step5.description:
- **Go to the Call tab**
- **Set Caller ID** (optional)
- **Enter the phone number** you want to call

step1.title: Follow the video tutorial
step1.description: Watch this step-by-step video guide to deposit SOL and make calls on your phone.

activateAccount.question: How to activate account?
activateAccount.answer: The first top up will activate your account. You need to do it only once.

supportedTokens.question: Which tokens are supported for deposits?
supportedTokens.answer: Only SOL on the Solana mainnet is accepted. Sending other assets may result in loss.

creditsAppear.question: How fast do credits appear?
creditsAppear.answer: Usually within a minute after confirmation. If it takes longer, refresh the Balance tab and check your transaction status.

storeLogs.question: Do you store call logs?
storeLogs.answer: No. Sessions are ephemeral; only metering data necessary to settle usage is recorded.

withdrawCredits.question: Can I withdraw unused credits?
withdrawCredits.answer: Yes. Please contact our customer support team via the Support section to process your withdrawal request.
